metadata.Description: Energy derived from biomass, such as organic materials or agricultural residues, through processes like combustion or fermentation.

entities.Description: Markets where electricity, natural gas, and other energy commodities are bought and sold.
The use of less energy to provide the same level of output or service, resulting in reduced energy consumption, cost savings, and environmental benefits.
Energy derived from biomass, such as organic materials or agricultural residues, through processes like combustion or fermentation.
The process of capturing and storing energy for later use.
Renewable energy certificates, also known as green certificates or tradable renewable certificates, are proof that a certain amount of electricity has been generated from renewable sources.

relations.Description: Bioenergy implements the Energy Efficiency Policy by promoting the use of renewable energy sources.
relations.Subject: bioenergy

relations.Description: Bioenergy funds research and development projects to improve the efficiency and sustainability of bioenergy production.
relations.Subject: bioenergy

relations.Description: Bioenergy focuses on sustainable biomass production to ensure the availability of renewable feedstock for bioenergy generation.
relations.Subject: bioenergy

relations.Description: Bioenergy plays a role in the renewable energy portfolio by contributing to the overall share of renewable energy sources.
relations.Subject: bioenergy

relations.Description: Bioenergy partners with local communities to promote the sustainable production and use of bioenergy, creating economic opportunities and reducing reliance on fossil fuels.
relations.Subject: bioenergy

relations.Description: Bioenergy contributes to climate change mitigation by reducing greenhouse gas emissions through the substitution of fossil fuels with renewable bioenergy.
relations.Subject: bioenergy

relations.Description: Bioenergy monitors the production of bioenergy to ensure compliance with sustainability criteria and environmental standards.
relations.Subject: bioenergy

relations.Description: Bioenergy targets rural electrification by providing decentralized energy solutions through the use of bioenergy technologies.

energy efficiency
relations.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.

relations.Subject: energy efficiency
relations.Description: Energy efficiency employs energy audits to identify energy-saving opportunities and optimize energy use.

relations.Description: Renewable energy certificates are implemented by the Energy Efficiency Policy to promote the use of renewable energy sources.

relations.Subject: renewable energy certificates
relations.Description: Renewable energy certificates contribute to climate change mitigation efforts by promoting the use of clean and sustainable energy sources.

relations.Subject: energy storage
relations.Description: Energy storage addresses the issue of intermittency in renewable energy sources by storing excess energy for use during periods of low generation.

relations.Subject: energy markets
relations.Description: Energy markets address the issue of energy access by ensuring the availability and affordability of energy sources for all segments of society.

relations.Subject: renewable energy certificates
relations.Description: Renewable energy certificates are implemented by the Energy Efficiency Policy to promote the use of renewable energy sources.

relations.Subject: energy efficiency
relations.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.

Biomass is a sub-component of bioenergy, referring to organic materials such as wood, crops, and agricultural residues that can be used as a renewable energy source. It can be converted into heat, electricity, or biofuels.
relations.Subject: biomass

relations.Description: Biofuels are a sub-component of bioenergy, referring to liquid or gaseous fuels derived from biomass. They can be used as a substitute for fossil fuels in transportation and other energy applications.
relations.Subject: biofuels

relations.Description: Biogas is a sub-component of bioenergy, referring to a mixture of gases produced by the anaerobic digestion or fermentation of organic matter. It can be used for heating, electricity generation, and as a vehicle fuel.
relations.Subject: biogas

relations.Description: Bioelectricity is a sub-component of bioenergy, referring to electricity generated from biomass through processes such as combustion, gasification, or anaerobic digestion. It can contribute to renewable energy generation and reduce greenhouse gas emissions.
relations.Subject: bioelectricity

relations.Description: Biochemicals are a sub-component of bioenergy, referring to chemicals produced from biomass through biological processes. They can be used as alternatives to fossil-based chemicals in various industries.
relations.Subject: biochemicals
